docblock.description: Get the results of a nomination or election period.
docblock.long-description:
Use this function to get the vote breakdown after the nomination/election for the specified position only.

Displays the results as a JSON encoded array of the positions and the names of the individuals and the number of votes they received.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The type of election period ("nomination" or "election")

tag.name: param
tag.description: The position to get the results for (President, Vice President, Coordinator, Treasurer). The default if no argument is provided is to get all positions.

docblock.description: Get the results of a nomination or election period.
docblock.long-description:
Use this function to get the vote breakdown after the nomination/election for ALL positions.

Displays the results as a JSON encoded array of the positions and the names of the individuals and the number of votes they received.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The type of election period ("nomination" or "election")

docblock.description: A function which returns a login session string which is the session username encrypted with AES256 and then encoded with base64

tag.name: param
tag.description: The username of the person logged in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The session encrypt/decrypt key

tag.name: return
tag.description: The generated login session for the user

docblock.description: A function which validates the session by decrypting the validate session variable and comparing it to the username session variable

tag.description: The mysqli connection object for the ucsc accounts DB

tag.name: param
tag.description: The session data to validate

tag.name: param
tag.description: The session encrypt/decrypt key

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if the decrypted validate session variable matches the username stored in the database

docblock.description: As the session login/cookie contain the username encrypted with AES256 and then encoded with base64, get the username from the session login/cookie by decrypting the data.
docblock.long-description: NOTE: This method is primarily used to get the username from a valid login cookie

tag.name: param
tag.description: The mysqli connection object for the ucsc accounts DB

tag.name: param
tag.description: The session data to validate

tag.name: param
tag.description: The session encrypt/decrypt key

tag.name: return
tag.description: The username stored in the session login/cookie

tag.description: The username of the person logging in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The password of the person logging in

tag.description: The AES encrypt/decrypt key for the password

tag.description: True if the login information provided is valid

docblock.description: A function which sets the session data for a valid user who has logged in to the elections website.
docblock.long-description: It starts the session and stores the login validation session variable, the username, access_account, and fullname of the user.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The mysqli connection object for the ucsc accounts DB

tag.name: param
tag.description: The username of the valid user who is logged in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The session encrypt/decrypt key

docblock.description: A function which sets sets a login cookie in the users browser so that they do not have to login each time they access the website.
docblock.long-description:
The login cookie by default is set for one day.

NOTE: This method requires that the user has already logged into the website with a valid account and that a login session has been created.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE If the cookie was set correctly in the user's browser

docblock.description: A function which validates the login cookie, this verifies that the login information set in the cookie is valid for the user, if it is then the user is logged in.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The mysqli connection object for the ucsc accounts DB

tag.name: param
tag.description: The session encrypt/decrypt key

tag.name: return
tag.description: If the cookie is a valid login cookie

docblock.description: Contains a collection of the functions that directly interact with the database to provide a convenient database abstraction layer, in the future support could be added to support other databases.
docblock.long-description:
At the moment the implementations are specific to MySQL (5.1 is the version tested) and prepared statements are used for all queries to provide a layer of protection against SQL injection.

TODO More work perhaps to add OOP features for scoping instead of just an aggregation of many functions, a hierarchy of classes would be nice

docblock.description: A function which handles a list of positions that a user is nominating themselves for and adds them to the list of nominees so that other users can vote for them.
docblock.long-description: This is a precaution so that other users cannot nominate someone for a position they do not want to be in.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The mysqli connection object for the ucsc elections DB

tag.name: param

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of the positions the user is nominating themselves for

docblock.description: A function which takes a list of the positions and nominee that the member voted for and adds a vote to that nominee if the user has not already cast a vote for that position.
docblock.long-description:
TODO Perhaps add some kind of AJAX support or page rendering support to remove positions they have already voted for. This covers the case where a user votes for maybe only one position and then returns to vote again.

TODO Perhaps add some kind of support where a user can change their vote, although most electoral systems don't have this...

tag.name: param
tag.description: The mysqli connection object for the ucsc elections DB

tag.name: param
tag.description: The unique (primary key) access account number of the user who is currently logged in

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of the positions and the full name of the nominee they voted for

docblock.description: A function for the final election voting, which takes a list of the positions and nominee that the member voted for and adds a vote to that nominee if the user has not already cast a vote for that position.
docblock.long-description:
TODO Add support to handle initially populating the positions_elect table using a PHP daemon (System_Daemon) instead of EACH TIME the function is called with the candidates and incumbents with a starting value of 0 votes

TODO This method along with the nomination_vote method can probably just be combined into one method "record_user_vote"

TODO Perhaps add some kind of AJAX support or page rendering support to remove positions they have already voted for. This covers the case where a user votes for maybe only one position and then returns to vote again.

TODO Perhaps add some kind of support where a user can change their vote, although most electoral systems don't have this...

tag.name: param
tag.description: The mysqli connection object for the ucsc elections DB

tag.name: param
tag.description: The unique (primary key) access account number of the user who is currently logged in

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of the positions and the full name of the nominee they voted for

docblock.description: A function which determines the winners of the election by comparing the number of votes that the candidate and incumbent each have.
docblock.long-description:
In the event of a tie between the candidate and incumbent for a position then the winning person is selected by a Pseudo Random Number Generator (PRNG) MOD 2 where 0 is candidate and 1 is the incumbent

TODO This is a method, along with the determine_candidate method that should be executed by the system_daemon

tag.name: param
tag.description: The mysqli connection object for the ucsc elections DB

tag.name: param
tag.description: The type of election to determine the winners for, a "nomination" or "election"

docblock.description: Contains an aggregate collection of miscellaneous utility functions, these are functions for things such as breaking a tie or calculating the the next date that is a day of the week.

A function which detemines the winner of an election in the case of a tie by using a Pseudo Random Number Generator (PRNG) MOD <# of tied nominees> where 0 is first nominee 1 is second nominee and so on for each nominee tied for the position

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of the nominees tied for the position

tag.name: return
tag.description: winner by random selection using a PRNG

docblock.description: A function which determines the next available date that falls on a weekday when executed.
docblock.long-description:
For example if the current date was a Friday then the next available date would be the Monday.

TODO Fix this to handle scenarios where the next day of the week occurs on the next month

tag.name: param
tag.description: The date you want to determine the next weekday for, formatted as 'Y-m-d-H-i'

tag.name: return
tag.description: The next available date that falls on a weekday in the format of year-month-day (ie. 2012-09-15) for September 15, 2012.

docblock.description: The following is a configuration file containing all of the election website authentication information such as the database access and database names as well as the AES encrypt/decrypt keys.
docblock.long-description: Basically, anything you wouldn't want everyone else to view and have access to goes in this file, as it is not part of the open source code that is publicly accessible.

docblock.description: The elections website daemon, this daemon runs in the background and creates the appropriate tables at the start of each election period (September 1st).
docblock.long-description:
On September 14 it closes the nomination period and determines the winners, then on the first school day afte September 14 the election is held, at which point at the end of the day (11:59pm) the election is closed and the results of the election are determined.

Why is this a daemon and not part of the main website? It makes more sense for this to operate independent of user interactions with the website.
